page.title: 17RECREATION
page.content: The two main sources of recreation are the "Horse and Jockey" Public HOuse and Fairthorne Manor. The Horse and Jockey has games like darts and dominoes. About 60 people use it. There is a children's garden at the back. The YMCA own Fairthorne Manor. It costs Â£26 to stay there for a week, but the prices vary, according to the accommodation. On average, l000 people go to the Manor in a year. All age groups from 5-65 are catered for. Most people go there in the summer, although it is open to the public for most of the year. There are 94 acres of land, and much of this is woodland. There is a golf course and there are many other recreational facilities. These are sailing, windsurfing, canoeing, orienteering, climbing, absailing,
